title: ICE: cat_expr Errd

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
maybe a bug in type inference?

I tried this code:

``` rust
fn main() {
    use std::mem::*;
    let a = 1;
    let b = 2;
    unsafe {swap::<&mut _>(transmute(&a), transmute(&b))};
}
```

and [playpen](http://is.gd/G6d2ta)
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`: 

```
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (d17d6e7f1 2015-04-02) (built 2015-04-03)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: d17d6e7f1f05fbdd4d9d246400ffebf768878c7a
commit-date: 2015-04-02
build-date: 2015-04-03
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.0.0-nightly
```
